title: Uprooted, Ep. 5: A New Home at Fort McCoy
description: Fort McCoy was one of four U.S. military installations that housed Cuban refugees after the Mariel Boatlift in 1980. Almost 15,000 Cubans lived there that summer and fall while waiting to connect with family members or find sponsors.
author: web-team@wpr.org (Wisconsin Public Radio)
category: Culture, History, North American History, Justice, Social Issues, Immigration, Latino, Race
